intro: Diaphananthe, commonly known as the goldenstar plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that resemble stars, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Diaphananthe species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. They are also used in traditional medicine in some cultures for their purported health benefits.
